desc: Students explore geographic, economic, political and ethnic dimensions of life in Costa Rica by combining intensive course work with such cross-cultural experiences as a homestay in San Jose, field work, visits to sites of cultural interest, and excursions to the Atlantic and Pacific coasts. They consolidate their language skills and continue to develop their skills for analyzing and communicating in Spanish through compositions, oral presentations, and interviews of Costa Ricans. Prerequisite: Spanish 231 or placement. Offered only during Interim.
name: Inter Span II-C Rica
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Spanish 231 or placement. Offered only during Interim.
title: Intermediate Spanish II in Costa Rica
